issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Setup*

2 x CLC, Walrus
2 x CC
1 x SC (tgtd) (_its located on one of the CCs_)
6 x NC

*Issue*

50 instances (46 of which were EBS-backed) were running fine.  All of a sudden, the 46 EBS-backed instances went to stop.  

*Status*

* New instances (EBS-backed and instance backed) can be launched.

* The DBs on both CLCs think there are only 9 instances running.

{noformat}
eucalyptus_cloud=# SELECT metadata_unique_name from metadata_instances;
  metadata_unique_name   
-------------------------
 783340485651:i-0E4640F8
 783340485651:i-E1773DBB
 783340485651:i-99BA4267
 783340485651:i-56D24289
 783340485651:i-67113F56
 783340485651:i-09553F64
 783340485651:i-66743D60
 783340485651:i-FB7942A6
 783340485651:i-464D4793
(9 rows)
{noformat}

* All physical machine show that they have been up for 22 days, except for the SC.

* Tried to start one of the EBS-backed instances in the _stopped_ state - went to terminated.

* CC/SC machine was rebooted due to some filesystem errors on the device that has /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes mounted:

{code}
fields.summary: Knowledge of 46 EBS-backed Instances Lost After Reboot of CC/SC Machine due to filesystem issues.

comments.body:
At this stage, we confirmed that multicast was being blocked by the environment, in addition to ARP proxy being enabled on the Cisco switches and this prevented proper NC communication on fail-over.

At this stage the user is no longer blocked, and I would recommend closing this issue.

Forget the history here, what we need is some assistance in recovering the ability to launch instances using the admin security group.  Previously, database surgery was needed by Chris to recover this.  Requesting some assistance from [~awithrow] to help prioritize a resource's help to work with Graziano on this.
Remote access is available, and can be shared with whomever the resource is that can work with us to determine the best way to recover this operation.
Resolved customer's issues by upgrading and manually migrating volumes over. Additional tickets opened to track other items.
Closing items resolved completed for released versions of the software.
